result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's Witness List.
Revoking Huber Privileges signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 09/02/2022.

to the Court filed by Jail Administrator Angela Wollenhaupt requesting revocation of defendant's Huber privileges.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 09/01/22--Given this information the Court is revoking it's authorization of huber bailee status for Mr. Baez. If necessary or requested the Court will further address this issue at the next scheduled court date. Clerk to draft order.**

Jury status hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:40 AM Defendant Richard Baez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.
Attorney Wolff presents arguments and requests to modify bail to lower cash bail or high signature bond.
The State presents arguments and objects to any modification.
For reasons set out on the record, the Court denies the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.


Attorney Wolff requests a status date with 30 days to go over the discovery and talk further with his client.
The Court will set the matter for Trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Peter M. Wolff.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/09/22--the Court will address at the 6/30 hearing.**

Bail/bond hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:35 PM Defendant Richard Baez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery, but not an offer.
Court sets a Bail/Bond Hearing. Atty Wolff to file a motion within one week.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:45 AM Defendant Richard Baez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status. 
Defense requests time to review discovery.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.

COURT LOWERS CASH BOND TO $5,000 FROM $10,000 WITH THE SAME CONDITIONS.
*Court does not object to Huber Bailee status if Defendant is unable to post.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant to have no contact with victim A (unless in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

09:52 AM Defendant Richard Baez in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alyssa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address motion to modify bond. 
Defense requests that cash bail be lowered or converted to signature bond, or that Defendant be granted Huber Bailee status.
State objects to any modification of bond.
Court will lower cash bond to $5,000 with the same conditions. 
Court has no objection to Huber Bailee status if unable to post.

  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.
